thread.title: South Korea's Dog Meat Tradition Defies Growing Pressure

title: South Korea's Dog Meat Tradition Defies Growing Pressure
text: South Korea's Dog Meat Tradition Defies Growing Pressure South Korea Faces Calls at Olympics to End Dog-Meat Trade By Warangkana Chomchuen and Min Sun Lee Feb. 25, 2018 10:30 am Pressure on South Korea to end the sale and consumption of dog meat, a declining culinary tradition, is growing as activists and athletes stepped up their campaign at the Winter Olympics. Photo: Getty Images Pyeongchang 2018 Video coverage of the 2018 Winter Games in Pyeongchang, South Korea. Up Next in Pyeongchang 2018 Ep.16 How the 'Garlic Girls' Turned South Korea Into a Curling Country Ep.1 Why North Korea Wants to Shine in the Olympic Spotlight Ep.2
